intro: Uragoga panurensis, commonly known as the Panurensis Flax, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Linaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the cooler months. Uragoga panurensis is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
